alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:53AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo, Torrance and Valencia. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval and Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until noon MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain due to persistent showers over Sandia Park, Tijeras, Edgewood, Moriarty and Estancia. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriarty, Estancia, Edgewood, Tijeras, Willard, Chilili, McIntosh, Escabosa, Tajique, Sedillo, Cedar Grove, Manzano, Cedar Crest, Manzano Mountain State Park, Sandia Park, Golden, Torreon, Miera, Ponderosa Pines and Cedro. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 173 and 205. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 207 and 227. This includes the following low water crossings... Primera Agua and Sandoval Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
